sect1.title: What's Covered Here?
sect1.para: Installation has been greatly simplified as &susemgr; &productnumber3; may now be selected as an extension during installation of &sle; 12. This chapter provides instruction on getting started with &susemgr; in a simple test environment. A kernel virtual machine (KVM) combined with Virt Manager will be used as a safe testing ground for your first installation. The following sections will guide you through:

listitem.para: Installation of &susemgr; &productnumber3; within a KVM virtual machine
Using the command line to initiate &susemgr; setup
Creating the admin user with the &susemgr; Web Interface
Making installation media and software available to your clients through &suse; Vendor channels
Using bootstrap to connect and manage your first client with &susemgr;

important.title: Prerequisites for this Guide
important.para: This section assumes you have already reviewed the &susemgr; Overview and Requirements section.

para.remark: This section is for internal use and guides an employee unfamiliar with &susemgr; through installing SUMA3 from the internal development repositories using &sle; 12.

step.para: Create a new virtual machine with Virtual Machine Manager
Within the New VM dialog box select Network Boot (PXE).

figure.title: PXE Boot as the Installation Method

step.para: Select Forward to continue.
For the operating system and Version choose Linux and &sle; 12 (or later).
Select Forward to continue.
On the next screen you will need to select the amount of memory and number of CPU's you wish to make available for the Virtual Machine. For testing we selected 4096 MB ram and 4 CPUs.

figure.title: Selecting Ram Quantity and Number of CPUs

step.para: Select Forward to proceed.

Select Managed or other existing storage and then Browse. You need to create a storage device with enough space to fulfil &susemgr; requirements. We will cover partitioning requirements within the installation section.
Next select New Volume.

For this guide &susemgr; requires 170 GB for its partitions. Name your storage volume and accept the default format of qcow2. Check the Storage Volume Quota available space and ensure your filesystem fulfils the 170 GB space requirement. Change the default vaule of 8.0 GB in the Max Capacity field to 170 GB.
Select Finish to proceed.
Select Choose Volume to continue. At the following dialog select Forward to continue.
Name your virtual machine.
Finally select Finish to finalize your virtual machine setup.

sect1.title: KVM: PXE Booting &sle; 12
sect1.para: After completing VM setup in KVM the VM will automatically boot to the PXE boot menu. The following procedure will guide you through PXE boot.

step.para: Select Unpacked SLE-12 ISOs via SLP to continue.
Select SLE 12 SP1 Server LATEST x86_64 DVD1

sect1.title: KVM: &sle; 12 Installation Procedure

step.para: Select your language and desired keyboard settings, you may change them if necessary. You need to accept the license agreement by checking I Agree to the License Terms to continue.
Proceed with Next to continue.

Enter the e-mail address associated with your (SCC) account and the registration code for &sle; Server. A successful registration is a prerequisite for getting product updates and being entitled to technical support.
Proceed with Next.

note.title: &susemgr; and Updating
note.para: If &sle; Server has been successfully registered at (SCC) you will be asked if you would like to install the latest available online updates. Choosing Yes provides the system with the most current updates and packages. If this option is selected, a manual update will be unnecessary after installation. These updates will also include the &susemgr; &productnumber3; updates if it was selected as an extension during installation.

sect1.para: The next section will continue by enabling the &susemgr; &productnumber3; extension within the &sle; 12 installation.

Click Next to continue.

important.para: Ornela, to add the Devel Extension for testing complete the following procedure.

step.para: Select I would like to install an additional Add On Product. Since you are working internally, you will need to specify the URL leading to the &susemgr; &productnumber3; developer image repository.
Leave the default value of Specify URL... and click Next to continue.

On the Repository URL screen you will need to name the repository you will be adding and provide the URL to the developer repository. Internal Up-to-date builds are found here Up-to-date &susemgr; Developer Builds
